member.name: T:Serilog.ConfigurationLoggerConfigurationExtensions
member.summary: Extends with support for System.Configuration appSettings elements.

member.name: F:Serilog.ConfigurationLoggerConfigurationExtensions.DefaultSectionName
member.summary: Configuration section name required by this package.

member.name: M:Serilog.ConfigurationLoggerConfigurationExtensions.Configuration(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSettingsConfiguration,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,System.String,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyModel.DependencyContext)
member.summary: Reads logger settings from the provided configuration object using the provided section name. Generally this is preferable over the other method that takes a configuration section. Only this version will populate IConfiguration parameters on target methods.
member.param: Logger setting configuration.
A configuration object which contains a Serilog section.
A section name for section which contains a Serilog section.
The dependency context from which sink/enricher packages can be located. If not supplied, the platform default will be used.
member.returns: An object allowing configuration to continue.

The dependency context from which sink/enricher packages can be located. If not supplied, the platform default will be used.
member.returns: An object allowing configuration to continue.

member.param: Logger setting configuration.
The Serilog configuration section
The dependency context from which sink/enricher packages can be located. If not supplied, the platform default will be used.

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationAssemblySource
member.summary: Defines how the package will identify the assemblies which are scanned for sinks and other Type information.

member.name: F:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationAssemblySource.UseLoadedAssemblies
member.summary: Try to scan the assemblies already in memory. This is the default. If GetEntryAssembly is null, fallback to DLL scanning.

member.name: F:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationAssemblySource.AlwaysScanDllFiles
member.summary: Scan for assemblies in DLLs from the working directory. This is the fallback when GetEntryAssembly is null.

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions
member.summary: Options to adjust how the configuration object is processed.

member.name: M:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.#ctor(System.Reflection.Assembly[])
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
member.param: A collection of assemblies that contains sinks and other types.

member.name: M:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Prefer the constructor taking explicit assemblies: . It's the only one supporting single-file publishing.

member.name: M:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyModel.DependencyContext)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
member.param: The dependency context from which sink/enricher packages can be located. If , the platform default will be used.
member.remarks: Prefer the constructor taking explicit assemblies: . It's the only one supporting single-file publishing.

member.name: M:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.#ctor(Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationAssemblySource)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
member.param: Defines how the package identifies assemblies to scan for sinks and other types.
member.remarks: Prefer the constructor taking explicit assemblies: . It's the only one supporting single-file publishing.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.SectionName
member.summary: The section name for section which contains a Serilog section. Defaults to Serilog.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.FormatProvider
member.summary: The used when converting strings to other object types. Defaults to the invariant culture.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.AllowInternalTypes
member.summary: Allows to use internal types for extension methods for sink configuration. Defaults to .

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.AllowInternalMethods
member.summary: Allows to use internal extension methods for sink configuration. Defaults to .

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.OnLevelSwitchCreated
member.summary:
Called when a log level switch is created while reading the configuration. Log level switches are created either from the Serilog:LevelSwitches section (declared switches) or the Serilog:MinimumLevel:Override section (minimum level override switches).
For declared switches, the switch name includes the leading $ character.
For minimum level override switches, the switch name is the (partial) namespace or type name of the override.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ConfigurationReaderOptions.OnFilterSwitchCreated
member.summary: Called when a log filter switch is created while reading the Serilog:FilterSwitches section of the configuration.

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ILoggingFilterSwitch
member.summary: A log event filter that can be modified at runtime.
member.remarks: Under the hood, the logging filter switch is either a Serilog.Expressions.LoggingFilterSwitch or a Serilog.Filters.Expressions.LoggingFilterSwitch instance.

member.name: P:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ILoggingFilterSwitch.Expression
member.summary: A filter expression against which log events will be tested. Only expressions that evaluate to true are included by the filter. A null expression will accept all events.

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ResolutionContext
member.summary: Keeps track of available elements that are useful when resolving values in the settings system.

member.name: M:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.ResolutionContext.LookUpLevelSwitchByName(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up a switch in the declared LoggingLevelSwitches
member.param: the name of a switch to look up
member.returns: the LoggingLevelSwitch registered with the name
member.exception: if no switch has been registered with

member.name: T:Serilog.Settings.Configuration.SurrogateConfigurationMethods
member.summary:
Contains "fake extension" methods for the Serilog configuration API. By default the settings know how to find extension methods, but some configuration are actually "regular" method calls and would not be found otherwise.
This static class contains internal methods that can be used instead.
